intro: Rosa dumalis f. subcalva, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dog玫瑰, is a flowering plant characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and pale pink to white flowers. It is a natural variant of Rosa dumalis, which is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a delicate fragrance and attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This form is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
